strong.a: Photos of from Black History Performance 2/20/2020
Photos of from Lindop Daddy Daughter Dance 2/14/2020

div.p: In honor of Hispanic Heritage Month, 14 students participated in a piñata contest. The students had a month to make a piñata at home with their families. These are the finished products!!! These students will be rewarded with a fiesta de pizza to celebrate their hard work!!!

font.span: On Friday, October 11th, 2019, Lindop School District 92 hosted it's first ever Men of Distinction Session from 8:30 a.m. to 10:30 a.m. in the gymnasium. All significant male figures were invited to school that day to engage in a session with Inner Vision's CEO and Motivational Speaker Dwayne Bryant. Mr. Bryant has provided the district with several Parent Universities in the past to engage parents around the topics from the impact of social media to community-police relationships. This session was targeted towards gang awareness and social media impact on students. Also, this allowed males to collaborate and communicate with one another. This session is part of Lindop School's Stragetic Plan:

span.span: Seek out opportunities to engage families, community agencies and networks. Develop and effectively communicate learning focused family and community partnerships that address community/family challenges which impact student development, growth and achievement both socially and academically.

h1.a: Lindop’s ‘Men Of Distinction’ Event Gives Dads Tools For 21st Century Parenting

p.style: line-height: 1.2; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; text-align: center; margin-left: 80px;

p.span: Positive and Highly Engaging School Climate:

Clarify the goals for social, emotional and behavioral learning and health for students and adults and review or refine curriculum and interventions to ensure alignment with the goals and promote student leadership inside and outside of the classroom.

On Friday, September 20th, the class of 1979 visited Lindop School to celebrate their 40th reunion.. They were excited to be in the building for the first time in decades and relive their experiences as students. Thank you to Bart Casper for organizing the event. We enjoyed helping them travel down memory lane.

h1.span: Lindop Staff Conduct Book Study on

div.p: On September 13, Lindop staff members engaged in a book study on Emotional Poverty in All Demographics by Dr. Ruby K. Payne.

div.em: Current conditions as of 26 Apr 14:53 pm CDT

td.span: Sunny, with a high near 58. North northeast wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.
Patchy frost after 5am. Otherwise, mostly clear, with a low around 37. North northeast wind 10 to 15 mph becoming light and variable in the evening.

Showers likely, mainly after 5pm. Increasing clouds, with a high near 64. Breezy, with a light south southwest wind increasing to 15 to 20 mph in the morning. Winds could gust as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.
